Name: Coop Conversion, Reserve Fund
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York with respect to increasing the reserve fund for cooperative conversions.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1.  Subdivision b of section 26-703 of chapter eight of title twenty-six of the administrative code of the city of New York, is hereby amended to read as follows:
	b.	Such fund shall be established in an amount equal to either (i) [three] ten percent of the total price, or (ii) (A) [three] ten percent of the actual sales price of all cooperative shares or condominium units sold by the offerer at the time the plan is declared effective, provided, however, if such amount is less than [one] three percent of the total price, then the fund shall be established as a minimum of [one] three percent of the total price, plus (B) supplemental contributions to be made by the offerer at a rate of [three] ten percent of the actual sales price of the cooperative shares or condominium units for each unit or its allocable shares held by the offerer and sold to bona fide purchasers subsequent to the effective date of the plan and within 5 year of the closing of the conversion pursuant to such plan notwithstanding that the total amount contributed may exceed [three] ten percent of the total price; and provided, further, that if five years from thirty days after the closing of the conversion pursuant to such plan the total contributions by the offerer to the fund are less than [three] ten percent of the total price the offerer shall pay the difference between the amount contributed and [three] ten percent of the total price.  Supplemental contributions shall be made within 30 days of each sale.
	ï¿½2.	This local law shall take effect immediately upon its enactment.
